tv.source-info-name: Pluto TV Space guide by TV

programme.title: In the Shadow of the Moon
programme.desc: Between 1968 and 1972, the world watched in awe each time an American spacecraft voyaged to the Moon. Only 12 men walked upon its surface and they remain the only human beings to have stood on another world.

programme.title: Trajectory - Milestones in Space Exploration
programme.desc: Project Mercury Advances - America's first manned space program finally puts a man in orbit. Camera Tracking - The array of special cameras that follow a spacecraft at launch. The International Space Station - The building and operation.

programme.title: The New Frontier: Gravity
programme.desc: LISA pathfinder, has led the way for a space based gravity wave detector, what are gravity waves and why are they so hard to detect?

programme.title: The New Frontier: Heavy Lift
programme.desc: New heavy lift rockets are taking to the sky. Falcon Heavy, SLS, Arianne 6 and Vega C rockets are primed to begin the next phase of space expansion.

programme.title: The New Frontier: Return To The Moon
programme.desc: The Moon, our closest celestial companion. Our indispensible dance partner through the cosmos.

programme.title: The Truth is in the Stars
programme.desc: Does our society have the capacity to live up to Star Trek's optimistic vision for humanity's future? William Shatner takes us on a journey to find out whether art has imitated life in the years since the world-renowned TV series premiered in 1966.

programme.title: The New Frontier: The Sun
programme.desc: It powers the machinery of nature; our weather, encourages and sustains life on land and at sea.

programme.title: Cosmic Vistas: Icy Gems: Frozen Moons
programme.desc: In the far depths of space, out of reach of the Sun's warmth, water can only exist in a super solid state. Some small moons, in fact, are made entirely of ice. What stories do these Icy Gems have to tell about our solar system?

programme.title: Cosmic Vistas: Hidden Havens: Icy Moons
programme.desc: There are hundreds of moons in our solar system. Could one of them be a hidden haven that harbors alien life forms?

programme.title: The New Frontier: Juno, Cassini and Beyond
programme.desc: The Cassini space craft has completed its mission over Saturn, Juno has reached its target and has commenced its scientific observations of the giant planet Jupiter.

programme.title: Cosmic Vistas: The Hot Zone
programme.desc: Mercury is one Earth's closest neighbors, but for centuries it eluded astronomer's best efforts to learn its secrets. But that has changed thanks to missions like Mariner and most recently, Messenger.

programme.title: The New Frontier: Shore To Shore
programme.desc: Our seafaring nature has translated well to the space age, seeking to sail out into the unknown in search of riches of one kind or another.

programme.title: The New Frontier: Martian Attractions
programme.desc: The Latest in Martian exploration from orbit and on the ground, new sources of water and planetary dust storms are a few of the stories unfolding on to the Red Planet.

programme.title: The Fabric of the Cosmos: Universe or Multiverse?
programme.desc: Cutting-edge theories are suggesting that our universe may not be the only universe. Instead, it may be just one of an infinite number of worlds that make up the multiverse.

programme.title: The New Frontier: Edge of The Universe
programme.desc: The night sky is a time machine. The further we look out into the universe the further back in time we reach.

programme.title: Cosmic Vistas: Outer Limits: Edge of the Solar System
programme.desc: For centuries, it was was thought that Saturn was the most distant planet in our Solar System. With the evolution of the telescope, we discovered the rest of our planets, both elusive and mysterious.

programme.title: Trajectory - Milestones in Space Exploration
programme.desc: Project Mercury Begins - The start of NASA & America's first manned space program. Mars Express - The European Space Agency's Mars Satellite. The Soyuz Launch System - The gradual evolution of Russia's Soyuz launcher.

programme.title: The New Frontier: The Inner Worlds
programme.desc: They orbit between us and our Star, the inner worlds; hidden within the sun's glare often only visible at sunrise or sunset.

programme.title: Cosmic Vistas
programme.desc: See the sun, moon, planets, and galaxies through the eyes of intrepid machines that are blazing a trail across the solar system. A gateway to bold adventures, these cameras are delivering spectacular new cosmic vistas.

programme.title: Spacetime: Gravity – The force that holds everything together
programme.desc: The force of gravity. Nothing and no one can escape from it. This mysterious power surrounds and permeates us. Gravitation determines our life on earth, holds the universe together and is the key to understanding the universe.

programme.title: Cosmic Vistas: Vesta Unveiled
programme.desc: With the Dawn missions exploration of the asteroid Vesta and the dwarf planet Ceres, asteroids are a hot topic. See what these incredible missions have uncovered.

programme.title: Cosmic Vistas: Galactic Visions: Alien Worlds
programme.desc: The diversity, complexity, and downright beauty of our own solar system is astounding. Could such beauty exist in other parts of the universe as well? Thanks to modern science, we now have the capability to see for ourselves.

programme.title: Trajectory - Milestones in Space Exploration
programme.desc: Project Gemini Advances - NASA refines the techniques needed for rendezvous. Cassini at Saturn - In the Cassini probe's final years of activity, its handlers are asking it to do more complex and risky assignments.

programme.title: The New Frontier: Flight Status
programme.desc: The latest updates on the new space hardware about to launch us into the next generation of space flight some rockets and capsules are on time others not so fortunate.

programme.title: The New Frontier: The Dark Side
programme.desc: Perhaps that American politician was right. There are indeed things we know we don’t know.

programme.title: Trajectory - Milestones in Space Exploration
programme.desc: Project Gemini Commences - Did Gemini give the US a lead in the space race? Venus Express - The last days of ESA's Venus probe. EMU - NASA's Extravehicular Mobility Unit. Deep Space Communications - ESA's worldwide network of giant dishes.

programme.title: Cosmic Vistas: Cosmic Rays
programme.desc: Cosmic rays can tell us much about the universe. They are not simply another form of light, but carriers of information about powerful and unseen processes at work thousands or even millions of light years away.

programme.title: The New Frontier: Emissaries
programme.desc: Our solar system is vast, from our own star the Sun to Earth is nearly 150 million kilometers or 1 Astronomical Unit.

programme.title: The New Frontier: Cosmic Collisions
programme.desc: Cosmic and x rays, these mysterious and highly powerful particles from deep space are being investigated to finally discover where they come from.

programme.title: The New Frontier: First Light
programme.desc: For an instrument first developed as recently as the 17th century, the telescope has travelled a long way.

programme.title: The New Frontier: PEERING INTO THE ABYSS
programme.desc: Imaging a black hole was a breakthrough in astronomy, now with the new satellite IXPE high energy telescope we will be looking at some of the most dramatic, and most violent objects in the universe: Colliding Black holes and Neutron Stars.
